quaternion

Class IntegerThreeSpaceUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • quaternion.IntegerThreeSpaceUtility

  • public class IntegerThreeSpaceUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class for determining the solution sets to the equation x2 + y2 + z2 = n, and exploiting the symmetry of these sets under the finite reflection group generated by the reflections along the three coordinate planes x=0, y=0, z=0, together with the six planes x=±y, y=±z, z=±x. This group is also known as the Coxeter group of type BC3, and the rotational subgroup (which is of index 2) is also known as the octahedral group.

    Points in integer 3-space are modeled simply by int arrays of length 3. A fundamental region for the group action is taken to be the set 0 ≤ x ≤ y ≤ z, and an ordering of the points in this region is defined by the lexicographic ordering.

    The set of integer points can be classified by their orbit type under the Coxeter group as follows. The type of a given point is represented as a pair of integers (t, s) with t ranging among the values {1, 2, 3, 4}, and s ranging among {1, 2, 3} for t=2 or t=3, while s=1 when t=1 or t=4 (no subtype). Let F1, F2, F3 be the faces of the fundamental region contained in the planes x=0, y=x, and z=y respectively, and let L1 = F1 ∩ F2, L2 = F1 ∩ F3, L3 = F2 ∩ F3.
    For an integer triplet p with fundamental representative p', we say that p is of type (t, s) with:
       t=4 : if p' is the origin
       t=3 : if p' is on one and only one of the rays L1, L2, L3
       t=2 : if p' is on one and only one of the faces F1, F2, F3
       t=1 : if p' is an interior point of the fundamental region (i.e in the region 0 < x < y < z)
    For t=2 and t=3, the subtype s is defined by the index on F and L respectively.

    The method getCoxeterOrbitClass(p) determines the type (t, s) of the point p and returns it as an int[] of length 2.

    Author:
    pdokos

    • Method Detail

      • getNumPoints

        public static int getNumPoints(int n)
        Returns the number of integer solutions to the equation x2 + y2 + z2 = n.
        Parameters:
        n - an int value >= 0.
        Returns:
        The number of integer point on the sphere of radius sqrt(n).

      • getFundamentalIntegerPoints

        public static java.util.List<int[]> getFundamentalIntegerPoints(int n)
        Returns a List of the integer solutions to the equation x2 + y2 + z2 = n lying in the fundamental region 0 ≤ x ≤ y ≤ z. The elements of the list are ordered lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        n - an int value > 0.
        Returns:
        A fundamental domain for the set of integer points on the sphere of radius sqrt(n) under the action of BC3 finite reflection group.

      • getIntegerPoints

        public static java.util.List<int[]> getIntegerPoints(int n)
        Returns a full List of the integer solutions to the equation x2 + y2 + z2 = n.
        Parameters:
        n - an int value >= 0.
        Returns:
        A List of the integer points on the sphere of radius sqrt(n).

      • getPositiveCoxeterOrbit

        public static java.util.List<int[]> getPositiveCoxeterOrbit(int[] pt)
        Returns a List of the points contained in the octahedral orbit of the fundamental representative of the given point. Note that the returned set either contains the given point or its antipodal point. For a point which lies on any of the planes of reflection, the octahedral orbit is necessarily closed under the antipodal map, and in this case, a List of representatives modulo the antipodal map is returned. The elements of the List are ordered in a consistent way according to the orbit type.

        Note that the full Coxeter orbit of the given point consists of the union of this set with the antipodal map applied to it.
        Parameters:
        pt - any int[] of length 3.
        Returns:
        A List of the points contained in the octahedral orbit of the fundamental representative of the given point. For points which lie on any of the planes of reflection, a List of representatives modulo the antipodal map is returned.

      • getOctahedralOrbit

        public static java.util.List<int[]> getOctahedralOrbit(int[] pt)

      • getCoxeterOrbit

        public static java.util.List<int[]> getCoxeterOrbit(int[] pt)
        Returns the full orbit of the given point under the BC3 reflection group. The elements of the List are arranged so that the positive Coxeter orbit of the fundamental representative of the given point occurs in the first half of the list, followed by the respective quaternion conjugates of the positive representatives in the second half. The elements in the first half of the list are ordered in a consistent way depending on the orbit type.
        Parameters:
        pt - any int[] of length 3.
        Returns:
        The full orbit of the given point under the BC3 reflection group.

      • getCoxeterOrbitSize

        public static int getCoxeterOrbitSize(int[] point)
        Return the size of the orbit of the given point under the BC3 reflection group. The size of the orbit is determined by the orbit class, and it is given as follows:
        Type:
           (4, 1) : orbit size 1
           (3, 3) : orbit size 8
           (3, 2) : orbit size 12
           (3, 1) : orbit size 6
           (2, k) : orbit size 24, for k=1, 2, 3
           (1, 1) : orbit size 48
        Parameters:
        point - any int[] of length 3.
        Returns:
        The size of the orbit of the given point under the BC3 reflection group.

      • getCoxeterOrbitClass

        public static int[] getCoxeterOrbitClass(int[] point)
        Returns the type of the given point in regard to action of the BC3 reflection group. The type of a given point is represented as a pair of integers (t, s), in the form of a length 2 int array. The value t ranges among the values {1, 2, 3, 4}, with s ranging among {1, 2, 3} for t=2 or t=3, while s=1 when t=1 or t=4 (no subtype). The meaning of these values is as follows. Let F1, F2, F3 be the faces of the fundamental region contained in the planes x=0, y=x, and z=y respectively, and let L1 = F1 ∩ F2, L2 = F1 ∩ F3, L3 = F2 ∩ F3.
        For an integer triplet p with fundamental representative p', we say that p is of type (t, s) with:
           t=4 : if p' is the origin
           t=3 : if p' is on one and only one of the rays L1, L2, L3
           t=2 : if p' is on one and only one of the faces F1, F2, F3
           t=1 : if p' is an interior point of the fundamental region (i.e in the region 0 < x < y < z)
        For t=2 and t=3, the subtype s is defined by the index on F and L respectively.

        Parameters:
        point - any int[] of length 3.
        Returns:
        An int[] of length 2 representing the type of the given point in regard to action of the BC3 reflection group.

      • getFundamentalRepresentative

        public static int[] getFundamentalRepresentative(int[] point)
        Returns the uniquely defined representative for the Coxeter orbit of the given point which lies in the fundamental region 0 ≤ x ≤ y ≤ z.
        Parameters:
        point - any int[] of length 3.
        Returns:
        An int[] of length 3 representing the uniquely defined point in the Coxeter orbit of the given point which lies in the fundamental region 0 ≤ x ≤ y ≤ z.
